title: Senior Associate, Analytics
description:
**Senior Associate, Analytics**

Building on your foundational analytics experience, you are now ready to take ownership of more complex projects and offer deeper strategic insights. As a Senior Associate, Analytics, you will lead analysis and reporting for key clients, collaborate on strategic recommendations, and act as a trusted partner in driving business results. Your experience and growing technical expertise will allow you to mentor junior team members and take on larger responsibilities in shaping the analytics practice.

**WHAT YOU'D DO:**

* Lead the analysis of campaign and customer data, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to improve marketing outcomes
* discover meaningful insights and build internal and external cross-functional relationships
* Uncover the narrative behind the numbers by going beyond reporting to analyze the layers of data, extracting insights, and clearly articulating their significance and implications for business outcomes
* Produces clear, accurate, and timely deliverables that analyze online user behavior and motivations, offering actionable insights to meet client business objectives
* Take ownership of QA processes, ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reports and dashboards
* Present complex analytics deliverables to senior-level clients, providing strategic guidance and recommendations
* Collaborates effectively with client teams to facilitate integrated cross-channel storytelling, data interpretation, insight generation, and the evolution of analytics programs
* Contribute to the development and implementation of advanced analytical tools, processes, and best practices
* Mentor junior analysts, helping them build their technical and strategic skills
* Demonstrate expertise in key analytics disciplines, leveraging advanced concepts to drive deeper insights for clients

**WHAT YOU'VE GOT:**

* 2-3 years of experience in media analytics, data analysis, or a related field, with demonstrated success in delivering insights
* Advanced proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and data visualization, with the ability to translate data into clear, actionable recommendations
* Expertise in various media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, etc.), with the ability to analyze and optimize campaign performance
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience engaging senior stakeholders and clients
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and balance competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
* A leadership mindset with a passion for growing within the analytics field and contributing to team development

title: Director - Product Management
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

This position will be a key member of the Global Data team responsible for the managing Platform & Product Development across Global Data Office Portfolio of Products and Solutions

* Develop and implement a comprehensive data platform strategy aligned with GDO and Visa’s business goals and objectives.

* Develop a comprehensive platform road map that aligns with businesses objectives and market opportunities.
* Define and prioritize platform requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to ensure the platform meets user needs and business goals.
* Lead the end-to-end product development life cycle, from initial concept and design through to development, testing, launch and post-launch optimization.
* Oversee critical features such as data ingestion, data quality, data enrichment, and data distribution to ensure the platform delivers high-quality and reliable data.
* Collaborate with engineering, data science, and other cross functional teams to ensure successful product delivery.
* Communicate product vision, strategy and Progress effectively to all stakeholders.
* Build and support strong relationships with key stakeholders, including internal teams and external partners.
* Define the data architecture and data governance strategy for the data platforms.
* Implement best practices for data management, including data quality measurement, data enrichment processes, and data distribution mechanisms.
* Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of product managers and data analysts, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback and coaching, and support professional development to ensure team members achieve their full potential.
* Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, using data-driven insights to identify areas for optimization and drive continuous improvement.
* Gather and incorporate feedback from stakeholders, including users and partners, to refine and enhance the product offering.
* Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies competitive landscape, market, and client needs, to shape the data acquisition roadmap and align strategic goals.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**

Basic Qualifications:  

* 10+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 7 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 4 years of work experience with a PhD, OR 13+ years of relevant work experience.

  
Preferred Qualifications:  

* 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD
* 10 years of experience in product management, with demonstrated ability to launch and manage new product releases being part of a matrix organization in a highly technical and evolving data space.
* Proven track record of successfully developing and managing data partnerships.
* Strong business acumen and knowledge of machine learning or data processing algorithms for Data Products
* Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.
* Fundamental and broad knowledge of common data management, data engineering tools and methodologies
* Expert knowledge of technology processes for data management (For e.g. Apache Spark, Postman, Artifactory, Python, Scikit Learn, Pandas, GitHub etc.)
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills needed to effectively communicate technical insights and recommendations with business customers and leadership team.
* Ability to think strategically and execute tactically.
* Strong experience in data science, deep learning models, cloud computing, and experience with big data and broader AI/ML tools, platforms, and technologies.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience with data analytics tools and technologies is a plus.
* Data Products experience in the card industry or financial service company using for fraud, credit risk, payments is a plus.
* Proficiency with software development methodologies such as Agile and experience working with Scrum teams and matrix organizations. Experience partnering with technologists using Agile or other expedited design and development methodologies.

 **Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 165,400.00 to 239,850.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**

title: Global Director of Revenue Growth
description:
Kore.ai is a globally recognized leader in the conversational and generative AI space helping enterprises deliver extraordinary experiences for their customers, employees, and contact center agents. Kore.ai’s goal is to empower businesses with effective, simple and responsible AI solutions that create engaging interactions. sectors serving over 100M of consumers and 500,000+ employees worldwide. With billions of interactions automated using our AI-powered technology, we have been able to save over $500M for these companies.

Kore.ai is one of the fastest growing AI companies globally. We are recognized as a leader by the leading technology and industry analysts like Gartner, Forrester, IDC, ISG, Everest, and others.

Founded in 2014 by serial successful entrepreneur, Raj Koneru, Kore.ai supports customers globally across offices in Orlando, Hyderabad, New York, London, Germany, Dubai Frankfurt, Tokyo and Seoul.

We’re reshaping the way companies harness the power of AI, simplifying and enhancing accessibility. Work alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry to pioneer safe, reliable solutions. Join the Kore.ai team and help companies of all sizes simplify the adoption of advanced AI solutions responsibly.

**Global Director of Revenue Growth**
-------------------------------------

As the Global Director of Revenue Growth, you will lead Kore.ai’s global team of Revenue Growth Consultants (RGCs) — a high-performing group responsible for shaping the earliest stages of the customer journey. You will set the strategic vision, coaching standards, and operational rhythm for how we identify, qualify, and mature sourced opportunities. Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer and partnering closely with the C-suite, you’ll be a key player in driving scalable pipeline growth and global revenue acceleration.

This is a leadership role for a data-driven, customer-obsessed, and collaborative professional who thrives at the intersection of sales strategy, team enablement, and go-to-market excellence.

**LOCATION:** Remote, US

### **RESPONSIBILITES:**

#### **Team Leadership & Enablement**

* Lead, coach, and inspire a global team of Revenue Growth Consultants across regions and verticals.
* Set clear performance expectations and KPIs; regularly assess team effectiveness and pipeline contribution.
* Partner with Sales Enablement to onboard, upskill, and continuously develop RGCs to meet evolving market and product demands.

#### **Pipeline Generation & Conversion Strategy**

* Own the global strategy for sourced pipeline development, including inbound and outbound, working closely with our BDR organization to ensure success.
* Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Sales to ensure campaigns and messaging are aligned to customer needs and GTM priorities.
* Monitor funnel metrics, opportunity quality, and handoff effectiveness to Account Executives and Solutions Engineers.

#### **Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Work closely with Business Development, Solutions Engineers, Account Executives, and Marketing to drive seamless buyer experiences.
* Align closely with C-level stakeholders to represent RGC performance, insights, and market feedback in quarterly planning and forecast reviews.

#### **Reporting & Performance Optimization**

* Build and manage dashboards and reports to track performance, conversion rates, and regional coverage.
* Present regular insights on team productivity, contribution to pipeline, and opportunity quality to executive leadership.
* Identify and implement tools, processes, and best practices to improve team efficiency and outcomes.

### **QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS REQUIRED****:**

* Minimum 5 years of experience in B2B technology sales or revenue operations required; previous experience working in the AI, CX, or automation space highly preferred.
* Minimum 3 years in a leadership capacity required.
* Proven success in managing global or regional pipeline generation teams (e.g., BDR, SDR, ISR, or pre-sales teams) required.
* Familiarity with multilingual/global sales operations and international GTM planning required.
* Previous experience working closely with C-suite executives and presenting in board-level settings required.
* Strong understanding of B2B SaaS sales cycles, opportunity qualification (e.g., BANT, MEDDIC), and enterprise buying behavior.
* Skilled in CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot), sales engagement tools, and performance analytics.
* Excellent communication, executive presence, and the ability to influence stakeholders across the organization.
* Comfortable operating in a high-growth, fast-paced, cross-functional environment.

Depending on specific professional experience and geographical location of individuals, the salary for this position ranges from $100,000 - $120,000. Additional wage/bonus/commission and benefit details will be shared during the formal interview process for this full-time employment opportunity.

title: Pharmacy Analyst
description:
Unlock the future of pharmaceutical insights! Join our team as a Pharmacy Analyst and pioneer data-driven strategies in healthcare excellence!

**Company Overview:**

River Valley Primary Care Services is committed to providing comprehensive healthcare to individuals from all backgrounds in Arkansas. We pride ourselves on being a Health Care Home that offers affordable services, including prescription assistance programs, ensuring that everyone has access to the healthcare they need.

**Summary:**

We are seeking a pharmacy analyst to assist with inventory management, pharmacy audits, PA Specialist, patient adherence & compliance, and train new employees.

**Responsibilities**

* Analyzing inventory and developing strategies to optimize inventory levels with lower cost for pharmacies.
* Identifying inefficiencies and developing strategies to improve each pharmacy.
* Ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and guidelines.
* Implementing patient adherence to ensure accuracy and efficiency is being met.
* Identifying and implementing process improvement for the pharmacy to reduce errors and improve efficiency.
* Train new hires on the RVPCS Pharmacy workflow, system, guidelines, and every day operations.
* Handling the pharmacy PBM audits and preparing the necessary documentation to demonstrate compliance.
* Providing technical support for pharmacy systems and equipment.
* Assure that the billing procedures performed by the pharmacy are accurate.
* Identify savings/profit opportunities by switching to our providers.
* Maintain system databases to reflect changes in the drug formulary or product specifications. Assure appropriate safeguards and system integrity.
* Handling the pharmacy patients Prior Authorizations (PA) are being done and completed in a timely manner.
* Analyze pharmacy data, identify trends, and improve medication use.
* Analyze financial and operational data to identify areas of cost savings.
* Analyze net loss reporting.

**Education & Experience:**

* High School diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in a pharmacy or customer service setting.
* Current/Active Pharmacy Tech certification or license.

**Skills/Abilities/Knowledge:**

* Supply management.
* Organization.
* Reporting/Analyst skills.
* Attention to detail.
* Quality focus.
* Communication.

title: Solution Architect – Master Data (SAP)
description:
**Company Description**

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

 **Job Description**

The Master Data Governance Solution Architect role will be responsible for architecture and solution implementation across key master data domains. Responsible for providing strategic leadership and technical expertise in designing and architecting Master Data Governance solutions that meet the complex business needs of the organization. This role will drive standardization, reusability, ensure compliance, and provide insight for continuous improvement.

Responsibilities:

* Lead the architecture and design of Master Data Governance (MDG) solutions, including defining system landscapes, data models, governance workflows, and integration points with other SAP modules and non-sap systems.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their master data requirements, pain points, objectives, and translate them into scalable and sustainable MDG architectures and designs.
* Engage with business stakeholders to understand their needs, ensure accurate planning and analysis by integrating business knowledge with technical solutions.
* Responsible for defining Business Requirements, leading the Business Blueprint & Design process, configuration, assistance with testing, requirements gathering and ultimately setup a fully functional development, test, and production environments
* Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) in master data management, metadata management, data quality, active governance, passive governance and data catalog operations.
* Develop Proof-of-Concept projects to validate new architectures and solutions.
* Lead user acceptance test planning, execution, and completion of the project on time.
* Identifies and quantifies risk, makes recommendations for risk mitigation and contingency plans. Escalate anticipated risk to management promptly and properly.
* Provide expert guidance on master data governance strategies, data governance frameworks, and data management principles, help establish effective governance structures and policies.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, developers, and system administrators, to ensure the successful implementation and integration master data solutions.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to resolve queries, provide training requirements, and recommend changes and enhancements to the system

  
**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree with 8 years’ experience or Master’s Degree with 7 years’ experience
* 7 years of progressive professional experience with data management leveraging SAP MDG, Syniti Knowledge Platform (SKP) or Data Stewardship Platform (DSP)
* Deep understanding of SAP Master Data business processes and critical data elements (e.g., tables, fields, structure)
* Basic understanding of programming languages (e.g., SQL, Syntax)
* Full lifecycle (blueprint to support) experience for large scale acquisition or implementation in an SAP environment
* Solid knowledge and experience with SAP material, customer, financial, and vendor domains
* Advanced ability to plan and lead workshops to elicit requirements analysis across global, cross-functional technical and non-technical teams

  
**Additional Information**

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

* The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.
* We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
* This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs.
* This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

title: Sales & Reporting Analyst
description:
**About KREWE**

KREWE is an independent, high-fashion eyewear brand rooted in the vibrant culture and boundless creativity of our hometown, New Orleans. Since our launch in 2013, KREWE has grown into a dynamic and evolving brand known for its distinctive, handcrafted sun and optical frames. Designed in New Orleans and meticulously crafted with exceptional attention to detail, our eyewear reflects a commitment to quality and individuality.

Our presence spans brick-and-mortar boutiques, innovative mobile and tiny house concept stores, and a thriving e-commerce platform. You can also find KREWE at premier independent shops and major retailers across the country. Celebrated for our unique approach to design, KREWE has cultivated a loyal following among style-conscious consumers and influential tastemakers.

As we continue to expand, we’re looking for passionate, driven, and innovative individuals to join our talented team. At KREWE our work is fun, intense, and fast-paced. We believe our people are our greatest asset and those that work at KREWE are high performing, passionate, and ambitious. People here work hard because they believe in [our mission] and the brand. At KREWE, you will be given the opportunity to own your role and truly make a difference, no matter your level. If this sounds like the right environment for you we invite you to apply below.

We are seeking a detail oriented and analytical **Sales and Reporting Analyst** to support our retail, e-commerce, and wholesale teams through data-driven insights and reporting. This role plays a key part in tracking sales performance, customer behavior, and inventory trends to help optimize merchandising, pricing, and promotional strategies in a fast-moving fashion environment.

This role is based in our New Orleans Headquarters 5 days a week.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Analyze sales performance metrics, trends, and key performance indicators (KPIs).
* Prepare and distribute regular reports and dashboards to track sales performance.
* Monitor sales targets and provide insights on opportunities for growth.
* Conduct variance analysis to identify sales trends and deviations from forecasts.
* Collect, clean, and organize sales data from multiple sources (CRM, ERP, POS, etc.).
* Develop and maintain dashboards using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
* Partner with IT and Sales Leaders to ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting platforms.
* Help develop and improve financial models and dashboards for better decision-making.
* Assist in sales forecasting and demand planning to support business strategy.
* Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to optimize pricing and promotions.
* Support ad hoc analysis and special projects as required.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
* 1-3 years of experience in financial analysis, accounting, or related roles (internships included).
* Strong Excel and financial modeling skills; experience with financial software (Oracle, Netsuite, or similar)
* Strong proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros) and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau).
* Experience with database management (SQL) or reporting automation/enhancement using AI is a plus, but not required.
* Familiarity with inventory management and/or retail business experience would be beneficial, but not necessary
* Solid understanding of sales performance metrics and reporting techniques.
* Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
* Excellent attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks.
* Strong communication and presentation skills across all levels of the organization and ability to collaborate with different
* teams

**Benefits and Perks:**

* Competitive wage
* Group health plans: health, vision and dental insurance
* Welfare benefits: life, ad&d, supplemental voluntary coverage
* FSA Plan & HSA Program
* 401(K) Investment Options
* Adoption Assistance, EAP, Commuter Benefits
* Paid Parental Leave
* Quarterly Cultural Spend
* Ongoing Training and Development, an Educational Allowance
* 10 paid holidays and Paid Time Off accrual
* KREWE employee frame discount (of course!)

**Diversity and Inclusion:**

*KREWE believes in providing an inclusive workplace where all individuals have the opportunity to succeed. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without discrimination or retaliation because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, pregnancy or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable local, state, or federal law.*

title: Insights & Strategy Specialist
description:
**Company Description**

RRD is a leading global provider of marketing, packaging, print, and supply chain solutions that elevate engagement across the complete customer journey. The company offers the industry’s most trusted portfolio of creative execution and world-wide business process consulting, with services designed to lower environmental impact. With 22,000 clients, including 93% of the Fortune 100, and 32,000 employees across 28 countries, RRD brings the expertise, execution, and scale designed to transform customer touchpoints into meaningful moments of impact.

 **Job Description**

The qualified candidate must have strong communication skills, adept at blending technical skills, analytical expertise, and business acumen. The Insights and Strategy Specialist will contribute to the execution and delivery of strategic analytic and insight projects for RRD’s clients and select internal constituencies.

The position will have a broad scope of responsibility, including data transformation, statistical analysis, strategy development, testing, and ROI optimization. He or she will gain experience across a variety of clients and applications and interact with various functional areas (Business Units, Marketing, Technology) and industries. The analyst must be comfortable both performing and presenting analysis at all levels of detail. The ideal candidate is an analytical thinker with a strong customer service mindset to execute and deliver thoughtful insights to clients and sales partners.

**Responsibilities:**

Execute analytical projects from established data requirements, that specific client deliverable, tasks, and analysis timing.

Work with internal teams to address client business problems, set expectations, communicate progress and issues, produce results, and deliver findings to clients in a highly professional manner.

Will be measuring program performance, identifying and implementing optimization techniques, computing performance lift and ROI.

Additionally our candidate will be helping to identify industry trends and opportunities to strengthen the Analytic and Business Intelligence teams.

 **Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline is required.
* Graduate Degree in statistics, mathematics, analytic MBA, or other quantitative graduate degree preferred.
* 1 year of relevant experience.
* A strong understanding of marketing strategy and analysis, campaign targeting, test design, and measurement is strongly preferred.
* Knowledge of statistical techniques and basic experimental design.
* Demonstrated strength in effective written and oral communication.
* Ability to provide direct client contact and presentation of technical/statistical findings to non-technical audiences.
* Hands-on experience using data query and analytic tools preferred
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, R) is a plus.
* Capable of working in a dynamic environment, handling multiple projects, meeting deadlines, able to prioritize appropriately and respond to issues quickly and creatively.
* Understanding of media, business or marketing. Able to use data as a tool for storytelling
* Analytical mindset/problem-solving skills.
* Powerpoint, Excel desired.

 **Additional Information**

RRD's current salary range for this role is $63,600 to $97,400 / year. The salary range may be adjusted based on the applicable geographic location of the hired employee, and the range may change in the future. At RRD, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions may vary based upon, but not limited to education, skills, experience, proficiency, performance, shift and location. Depending on the role, in addition to base salary, the total compensation package may also include participation in a bonus, commission or incentive program. RRD’s benefit offerings include medical, dental, and vision coverage, paid time off, disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, life insurance and other voluntary supplemental insurance coverages, plus parental leave, adoption assistance, tuition assistance and employer/partner discounts.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

RRD is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

#LI-LC4

RRD is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

title: Senior Security Analyst / Audit Liaison
description:
**Brief Overview of Position:**

Strategic Operational Solutions (STOPSO) is seeking candidates for a Senior Security Analyst/Audit Liaison to support a Department of Homeland Security client. STOPSO is ISO 9001, ISO 20000-1, ISO 27001 certified and CMMI-SVC Level 2 appraised IT Services and Solutions company. We look for talented people to join our Team to develop and deliver solutions. Our environment is cutting-edge and highly rewarding, our team members are constantly learning and sharing their knowledge with our customers and each other. The person will fill a vital role within an organization, particularly within federal programs, where the emphasis lies on ensuring compliance, transparency, and efficiency in financial processes. This position is responsible for serving as the primary point of contact between the organization and external auditors. The Audit Liaison Specialist facilitates communication, coordinates audit activities, and ensures that all audit requirements are met promptly and accurately.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Audit Coordination:** Serve as the primary point of contact for external auditors. Coordinate audit schedules, access to documents, and meetings between auditors and internal staff.
* **Documentation Management:** Maintain and organize all audit-related documentation, ensuring that records are complete, accurate, and readily accessible. Assist in preparing responses to audit queries and requests for information.
* **Compliance Assurance:** Ensure adherence to all relevant regulations, policies, and procedures. Continuously monitor compliance within federal programs and advise on best practices to mitigate risks.
* **Communication Facilitation:** Function as a liaison to facilitate effective communication between auditors and various departmental teams. Clarify audit requirements and provide guidance to staff on how to meet those expectations.
* **Risk Assessment:** Identify areas of potential risk and work proactively to address issues before they escalate. Collaborate with internal teams to implement corrective actions when necessary.
* **Training and Support:** Provide training and support to employees on audit processes, compliance standards, and documentation practices. Foster an environment of continuous improvement and education.
* **Reporting and Analysis:** Compile and analyze audit findings, developing comprehensive reports for senior management. Recommend actionable insights to enhance operational efficiency and compliance.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications (e.g., CPA, CIA) are highly desirable.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in audit coordination, compliance, or a related field. Previous experience within federal programs or government agencies is preferred.
* **Skills:** Strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication abilities. Proficiency in audit software and database management systems.
* **Knowledge:** In-depth understanding of federal regulations, auditing standards, and compliance requirements. Familiarity with government accounting practices and procedures.
* **Attributes:** Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy. Ability to multitask and work under pressure. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Must be a U.S Citizen with an active secret clearance.

title: QC Lab Analyst (Bayport)
description:
**Title: Quality Control Analyst (DuPont Shift)**

**Location: Pasadena, TX**

**Who we are:**

**Voted one of the Nation's Best and Brightest Companies to Work for, Kuraray America, Inc. (KAI)** is a global leader in specialty chemical, fiber, and resin production. With top-of-the-line research and production facilities and a vast network of supplies from around the world, Kuraray leads the industry in specialty dental, fiber, resin, and elastomer products. Kuraray America is a wholly owned subsidiary of Kuraray Company, Ltd. Based in Tokyo, Japan. Kuraray has operations in 31 countries and employs more than 11,000 employees, including over 800 in the United States.

**Why Kuraray:**

Kuraray is building a better tomorrow, today. Our team members are dedicated to expanding our business with committed professionals who share essential values such as integrity, excellence, teamwork, and accountability.

As a part of Kuraray America, Inc., our team shares the advantages of working for the leader in specialty chemicals, resins, and fibers. Our international presence and resources allow us to be a world-leading innovator in the industries we service. Yet, despite our size, our people are more than just a number. As a new team member, you can expect to earn responsibility quickly. Our commitment to our people is visible in our comprehensive benefits package. As a Kuraray team member, you will have the opportunity to enjoy competitive salaries and benefits, incentive opportunities, and an excellent work environment.

**Position Summary:**

The QC Lab Analyst provides comprehensive analytical support to the Production Department through testing in-process and final product samples while ensuring all sample analyses adhere to established quality standards. The analyst calibrates laboratory instrumentation in accordance with company procedures, performs complex tests using specialized methods and equipment, and contributes to quality management activities. This role is essential in maintaining product quality, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence within the DuPont Shift structure.

**Responsibilities:**

**Laboratory Analysis & Testing**

* Analyze and report the disposition of in-process and final product samples using specialized methods and equipment
* Evaluate reported results for consistency with the process
* Conduct non-routine sample testing using approved procedures and methodology
* Validate and interpret test data to verify specifications are met and identify remedial actions required to ensure conformance
* Troubleshoot questionable test results through analytical problem-solving

**Equipment Management & Calibration**

* Perform routine calibration checks of laboratory equipment according to established protocols
* Maintain and troubleshoot laboratory instrumentation
* Prepare tests and standardize laboratory instrumentation

**Sample Management**

* Manage and organize retain samples
* Prepare and ship samples to plant and other parties as necessary
* Maintain proper documentation of all sample processing activities

**Operational Excellence**

* Aid Lab Manager, Supervisor and Chemist in laboratory operations

**Health, Safety & Compliance**

* Understand and comply with regulatory, company, and departmental Health, Safety, Environmental, and Security guidelines, policies, and procedures
* Follow the organization's health, safety, and environment policies to identify and mitigate environmental risks
* Attend and participate in scheduled safety training, operational training, and employee meetings
* Understand and utilize SOPs and proper PPE when performing routine and required tasks

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent required + 3 years of laboratory experience focusing on polymers; OR
* Associate degree plus 1 year of laboratory experience focusing on polymers
* Experience in calibrating and standardizing laboratory instrumentation
* Hands-on experience with polymer testing equipment
* Understanding of SAP, LIMS, and quality management systems
* Proficiency with standard office software and ability to prepare complex documents
* Experience in troubleshooting instrumentation and analytical methodologies
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to prioritize work to manage multiple projects to meet deadlines.
* Excellent problem-solving/decision-making skills.
* Ability to multi-task
Candidates must have a valid driver's license.  

  

**Competencies**:

* Customer Focus
  + Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
* Business Insight
  + Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals.
* Cultivates Innovation
  + Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful.

* Action Oriented
  + Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
* Ensures Accountability
  + Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
* Drives Results
  + Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstance
* Collaborates
  + Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
* Values Difference
  + Recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization
* Communicates Effectively
  + Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
* Courage
  + Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what needs to be said.
* Instills Trust
  + Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
* Situational Adaptability
  + Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.

We offer a competitive compensation package that includes base pay and an annual incentive. This program is designed to reward individual performance and align overall rewards with corporate and team performance.

Our employees benefit from a robust healthcare package that includes wellness reimbursements, along with generous perks such as three weeks of paid time off, ten company holidays, paid parental leave, education reimbursement, and a matching 401k plan, among other offerings.

  

**Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S.**

**Learn more at** **kuraray.us.com/careers/**

Kuraray America, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/disability/protected veteran status

**No third-party candidates accepted.**

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
**Everyone belongs at Malarkey!**

**Malarkey takes pride in selecting our most important asset, our employees. Become a part of our mission to manufacture and deliver innovative, performance-driven building products with service and integrity that is unparalleled.**

The **Pricing Analyst** will help determine competitive pricing strategies to gain market share and achieve revenue goals. They will analyze data from multiple sources, develop complex pricing models, and collaborate with Sales Operations Management, Sales Management, and the sales team to develop strategies.

  

* Assesses data from various sources to gain insights into pricing strategies and market trends.
* Participates in current pricing tasks as well as analysis to move the company into a better overall pricing strategy, processes, and workflow.
* Analyzes competitor pricing and market trends to increase market share and profitability.
* Tracks customer engagement to develop effective pricing strategies for products and offerings.
* Applies statistical modeling methods to determine the potential impact of pricing strategies on profitability.

**Knowledge, Education, and Experience**

A bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, or related fields is required. A master's degree in business administration is preferred. At least five years of experience as a pricing analyst in a similar industry. Proficiency in business intelligence (BI) software, Microsoft Power BI. In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis. Extensive experience in analyzing pricing strategies and forecasting revenue and market share. Experience in collaborating on pricing strategies with sales and marketing departments. Ability to keep abreast of industry trends and develop dynamic pricing tools. Advanced ability to present pricing analysis reports to relevant stakeholders-excellent analytical and communication skills.

* Expert-level Excel skills are required.
* Analytical: Strong analytical skills are necessary to compare sales trends and determine market data.
* Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential, as pricing analysts work with team members at all levels, including store associates, office staff, and executive team members.
* Detail-oriented: The ability to pay close attention to detail while remaining accurate is crucial in the analysis of large collections of data.
* Problem-solving: Pricing analysts use problem-solving skills to identify declining sales trends and devise strategies to improve them.

**When you join the Malarkey family, you have access to enhanced health care designed to keep you and your family healthy for today and for the future. Malarkey also offers financial wellness planning and contributions to your retirement plan. Our programs allow our employees to thrive and achieve success both at work and in their personal lives. Malarkey offers Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Accident Death and Dismemberment, and a retirement plan.**

**Malarkey Roofing Products is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.**

**Today's Talent, Tomorrow's Success**

title: FP&A Analyst
description:
**POSITION TITLE:** FP&A Analyst.

**DEPARTMENT:** Tarter.

**REPORTS TO:** Director, FP&A.

**STATUS:** Full Time Hourly Position.

**Join the Tarter Team as a Financial Analyst!**

At Tarter, we are committed to delivering exceptional value to our customers and employees. We’re seeking a driven and detail-oriented Financial Analyst to join our team and contribute to the company's financial success. As a key member of our Finance team, you’ll play a vital role in financial planning, pricing analysis, and decision support across the organization.

**Position Summary:**

The Financial Analyst will provide critical financial insights to support strategic decision-making processes at Tarter. In this role, you will support the Director of FP&A. You will analyze financial performance, maintain financial models, and develop reporting that drives business outcomes. You will collaborate closely with Sales, Accounting, and Operations teams to ensure the accuracy of financial data and support data-driven decision-making processes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Financial Performance Analysis:**

* Analyze financial performance, comparing actual results with budget, forecasts, and historical data, and provide actionable insights to senior leadership to support decision-making and strategy development.
* Track financial trends and performance metrics, offering recommendations for optimization based on both internal performance and industry benchmarks.
* Lead cost-saving and productivity initiatives, monitoring their impact across various departments and identifying opportunities for operational efficiencies.

**Financial Modeling & Reporting:**

* Develop and maintain comprehensive financial models to support business planning, budgeting, and strategic decision-making.
* Prepare and present detailed monthly, quarterly, and ad-hoc financial reports to senior management, ensuring key insights and trends are clearly communicated for informed strategic planning.
* Provide in-depth reporting on key financial metrics, including sales, orders, and key performance indicators (KPIs), to support operational and financial objectives.

**Annual Budgeting & Quarterly Forecasting:**

* Support the preparation and coordination of the annual budget process, collaborating with department heads to gather inputs, align financial objectives, and ensure that the budget reflects organizational goals.
* Lead the quarterly forecasting process, adjusting financial projections based on actual performance, market changes, and evolving business needs, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.
* Provide detailed analysis on variances between forecasted and actual results, offering insights and recommendations to ensure financial goals are met.

**Collaboration & Strategic Support:**

* Partner with cross-functional teams, including Sales and Operations, to align on financial goals and provide insights into performance.
* Support customer-facing meetings with in-depth financial analysis, offering data-driven insights to guide business strategies and promote financial discipline.
* Lead the analysis and reporting of Year-to-Date (YTD) expenditures and cost management initiatives, ensuring financial integrity and alignment with strategic goals.

**Data Integrity & Continuous Improvement:**

* Monitor financial processes and reporting, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and alignment with corporate financial goals.
* Continuously evaluate and implement improvements in financial systems, tools, and reporting methods to increase efficiency and data accuracy.

**Qualifications & Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in financial analysis, pricing, or a related role.
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis, and business intelligence tools.
* Familiarity with ERP systems, preferably Epicor.
* Advanced Excel skills; experience with data visualization tools is a plus.
* Proven ability to analyze large datasets and provide strategic recommendations.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present financial insights to both financial and non-financial stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to identifying issues and implementing solutions.

title: Sr. Analyst, Commerce & Growth Product Analytics
description:
**Company Description**

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('SpinCo') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.

 **Job Description**

The Media Group at NBCU supports a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands including Peacock, NBC, Bravo, NBC Sports, and NBCU International. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with the Senior Manager of Product Analytics to optimize acquisition product experiences, providing a data-driven, objective perspective that aligns cross-functional teams on performance against key goals.
* Execute against an acquisition analytics and experimentation roadmap for the Commerce Product & Growth teams, deriving insights that drive impact for the business
* Work within large datasets to interpret trends and turn those into sound recommendations
* Maintain, update, and distribute actionable dashboards or reports to ensure data democratization and informed decision making
* Partner with Data Engineering teams to identify and enhance data sources
* Prepare and inform material for senior level executive presentations
* Leverage data visualization tools like Tableau to curate reporting for cross-functional teams

  
**Qualifications**  

* 4+ years of experience working with analytics engineering and product analytics stack (e.g. Databricks, BigQuery, Tableau, Looker, Airflow, dbt, Github, etc.)
* 4+ years of applied experience in acquisition, subscriptions, direct to consumer or media entertainment. Familiarity with data challenges specific to subscription and user behavior analytics.
* Proficiency in dimensional modeling and designing datasets for business analytics use cases, preferably within Databricks.
* Advanced SQL skills for analytics and data analysis (Python or R.)
* Experience performing analysis with large time series datasets.
* Experience in defining data collection and measurement requirements.

**Desired Characteristics**

* Curious and passionate about democratizing data access and scalability; you operate with a bias for informed action.
* Possess a growth mindset and see failure as a necessary step towards advancing learning of yourself and those around you.
* Collaborative and skilled in working across teams to align insights and technical solutions with business objectives.

**Additional Requirements:**

**Hybrid**: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.

*Salary range: $85,000 - $115,000*

 **Additional Information**

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Senior Finance Analyst
description:
The Senior Financial Analyst will lead budgeting, forecasting, and cost optimization efforts across manufacturing and supply chain operations. This role will develop financial models, analyze variances, and identify opportunities for cost reduction. The Senior Financial Analyst will collaborate with Operations, Procurement, and IT to enhance reporting tools, support capital investment decisions, and ensure financial compliance with GAAP, IFRS, and HGB. This role also oversees customs site operations and drives process improvements to increase efficiency and financial performance.

**Your role in our team**

* You will develop and manage financial models to support budgeting, forecasting, and long-term planning.
* You will provide variance analysis between actual and budgeted/forecasted financial performance.
* You will evaluate and monitor manufacturing costs, including raw materials, labor, and overhead.
* You will provide financial insights for supply chain, procurement, and inventory management.
* You will work closely with production and operations teams to optimize cost structures.
* You will identify cost-saving opportunities through process improvements and efficiency initiatives.
* You will support capital investment decisions with financial justifications (ROI, NPV, payback period).
* Prepare financial reports for senior management, including dashboards and executive summaries.
* You will ensure compliance with GAAP/IFRS/HGB (German GAAP) and internal accounting policies.
* You will assist with internal and external audits.
* You will collaborate with management to develop monthly forecasts & annual budgets for cost centers
* You will manage customs site operations and support the customs broker in efficiently processing imports through U.S. Customs.
* You will partner with IT to enhance financial reporting tools
* You will lead or support internal process improvement initiatives

**Your profile**

* You have a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related business field. An MBA or CPA/CMA certification is a plus, indicating advanced financial expertise.
* You have a minimum of five years of relevant experience in manufacturing finance, supply chain finance, cost center controlling, or related areas.
* You have experience with Lean/Six Sigma methodologies is a plus, especially for process improvement and cost reduction initiatives
* You have strong financial modeling and forecasting abilities
* You have expertise in budgeting, variance analysis, and cost control.
* You have the ability to function well in a high-paced environment and deliver results to meet timelines
* You have SAP experience
* You have advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, etc.).
* You have experience with business intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar)
* You have knowledge of financial reporting systems and GAAP/IFRS/HGB (German GAAP) compliance
* You have experience working in a manufacturing & project environment
* You have a strength in presenting financial insights to senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
* You have experience collaborating with plant managers, operations, supply chain, and sales teams.
* You have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced manufacturing environment with shifting priorities.
* You have a continuous learning mindset, staying current with financial best practices and industry trends.
* You have a keen eye for detail and excel at working with large data sets and complex reports.
* Other duties as assigned

Eligible applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

**Your working environment at Körber**

Körber is pioneering cutting-edge sorting technology and solutions that shape the future of mail and parcel automation across Europe, North America and Asia. Set new industry standards and champion customer-centric services and solutions with our dynamic parcel logistics team based in Irving, Texas, USA. This full-time, exempt role offers a hybrid work setting.

**Your benefits**

* You will enjoy a flexible work environment that supports your work-life balance; we offer paid time off for parental leave and 22+ days off for personal time and holidays
* You will have access to medical, dental, and vision insurance plans with FSA or HSA options, and a 401(k) plan with a company match up to six percent
* You are provided with several company-paid benefits, including vision insurance, short and long-term disability and basic life insurance plans, and educational and employee assistance programs
* Your annual base pay range for this role is estimated to be $80,000 - $100,000 at the time of posting

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Dallas, TX 75261

title: Accounts Receivable & Cost Support – Full-Time | On-Site |
description:
**Join One of the Fastest-Growing Manufacturers in the Mobile Food Industry**

**United Food Truck** is a rapidly expanding manufacturer of custom Food Trucks, Concession Trailers, and Mobile Units, serving clients across the United States and the Caribbean. We are recognized for our innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, and we are looking for talented professionals to grow with us.

**Job Overview**  
We are currently seeking a **bilingual (English/Spanish) Accounts Receivable & Cost Support Analyst** to join our in-office accounting team. This role is key to ensuring the accurate management of customer accounts, supporting financial operations, and helping optimize the company’s cost structure.

**Responsibilities**

* Manage **Accounts Receivable**: invoicing, tracking, collections, and follow-ups
* Perform **bank and credit card reconciliations**
* Track and **cost-code all expenses** in QuickBooks Online
* Collaborate in **updating and optimizing the company’s cost structure**, providing insight for financial efficiency
* Maintain clear and organized records using **Excel** and **QuickBooks Online**
* Liaise closely with the **Sales** and **Operations** departments
* Communicate with **vendors and customers** in English and Spanish
* Assist in the **search and management of suppliers and vendors**
* Prepare and file **state tax returns** with the **Florida Department of Revenue**
* Handle **legal procedures with authorities** for the delivery and registration of manufactured mobile units
* Support **month-end closings** and general bookkeeping activities

**Skills**

* **Bachelor’s degree in Accounting**
* **QuickBooks** **Online**
* Minimum **2 years of general bookkeeping or AR experience**
* **Proficiency in Microsoft Excel**
* Excellent **communication and organizational skills**
* **Fluent in English and Spanish** (mandatory

title: Power Platform Developer - part time - Remote
description:
Solicitation Reference Number: VetEd1 Working Title: Power Platform Developer Title/Level: Developer/Programmer Analyst 1

Category: Applications/Software Development Part Time NTE Rate:$63/hr

I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES

Texas Veterans Commission requires the services of 1 Developer/Programmer Analyst 1, hereafter referred to as Candidate(s), who meets the general qualifications of Developer/Programmer Analyst 1, Applications/Software Development and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Veterans Commission.

All work products resulting from the project shall be considered "works made for hire" and are the property of the Texas Veterans Commission and may include pre-selection requirements that potential Vendors (and their Candidates) submit to and satisfy criminal background checks as authorized by Texas law. Texas Veterans Commission will pay no fees for interviews or discussions, which occur during the process of selecting a Candidate(s).

Responsible for creating and managing solutions using Microsoft's Power Platform suite, which includes Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Virtual Agents. Here are some key job duties for this role:

1. Develop Applications: Design, develop, and maintain custom business applications using Power Apps to address specific business needs

2. Automate Workflows: Use Power Automate to create and manage automated workflows that streamline business processes

3. Data Visualization: Develop and maintain data visualization and reporting solutions using Power BI to provide actionable insights

4. Integration: Integrate Power Platform solutions with other Microsoft services (like SharePoint) and third-party applications to ensure seamless operation

5. Collaboration: Work closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications

6. Technical Support: Provide ongoing technical support and training to users to ensure they can effectively use the solutions developed

II. CANDIDATE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Requirements:

Candidates that do not meet or exceed the minimum stated requirements (skills/experience) will be displayed to customers but may not be chosen for this opportunity.

Years Required/Preferred Experience

3 Required Power Apps Developer, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Virtual Agents

III. TERMS OF SERVICE

Services are expected to start 07/01/2025 and are expected to complete by 12/31/2025. Total estimated hours per Candidate shall not exceed 400 hours. This service may be amended, renewed, and/or extended providing both parties agree to do so in writing.

IV. WORK HOURS AND LOCATION

Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the Texas Veterans Commission. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed.

The primary work location(s) will be at Remote. The working position is Telework. Any and all travel, per diem, parking, and/or living expenses shall be at the Candidate's and/or Vendor's expense. Texas Veterans Commission will provide pre-approved, written authorization for travel for any services to be performed away from the primary work location(s). Pre-approved travel expenses are limited to the rates and comply with the rules prescribed by the State of Texas for travel by its classified employees, including any requirement for original receipts.

The Candidate(s) may be required to work outside the normal business hours on weekends, evenings and holidays, as requested. Payment for work over 40 hours will be at the hourly rate quoted and must be coordinated and pre-approved through Texas Veterans Commission.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $43.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Work from home

Application Question(s):

* If interested, please leave your email, contact number and best time to reach you

Experience:

* Power Apps Developer, Power Automate: 3 years (Preferred)
* Power BI, and Power Virtual Agents: 3 years (Preferred)
* State of texas client : 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Oracle CPQ -OM Analyst
description:
**About Us**

We are a global climate technologies company engineered for sustainability. We create sustainable and efficient residential, commercial and industrial spaces through HVACR technologies. We protect temperature-sensitive goods throughout the cold chain. And we bring comfort to people globally. Best-in-class engineering, design and manufacturing combined with category-leading brands in compression, controls, software and monitoring solutions result in next-generation climate technology that is built for the needs of the world ahead.

Whether you are a professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring your first opportunity, or recent graduate with an advanced degree, we have opportunities that will allow you to innovate, be challenged and make an impact. Join our team and start your journey today!

**Job Summery**

If you are an INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Copeland has an exciting opportunity for you! You will have the responsibility to Support the Order Management applications delivery solutions in a global environment. This role can be based at any Copeland India location.

You will support business users in Oracle CPQ/ EBS Application Suite R12.2.4. You will be adept will continually work with key business users to maintain, enhance, and augment the core capabilities of the Oracle CPQ and Order Management Application. You will be responsible for working enhancements, governance, general support, and break-fix in the Oracle Order booking and shipping area. You will collaborate with internal IT as well as the business users to rectify Oracle functional issues and spec out requirements pertaining to business-requested enhancements.

**WHO YOU ARE:**

You show a tremendous amount of initiative in tough situations and are exceptional at spotting and seizing opportunities. You use customer insights to drive and guide the development of new offerings. You serve as a strategic partner to build, grow, and maintain profitable and long-lasting relationships with key accounts.

**AS A IT ANALYST, YOU WILL:**

* Gather and analyze requirements for new applications, or modifications to existing applications.
* Be responsible for designing, configuring, testing, implementing, and maintaining Oracle CPQ and Order Management modules.
* Conduct end-user training and triage support requests across Oracle applications.
* Address end-user issues and problems without assistance from other functional analysts.
* Prepare MD050s and configurations sheets.
* Be available for occasional weekend and off-hours on-call support for critical Sev1 issues and scheduled activities.
* Participate in medium/large Oracle projects.

**REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science/information technology or equivalent.
* Minimum 1 to 5 years of experience in business analysis utilizing the Oracle CPQ/ eBusiness systems, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Provide comprehensive technical guidance and support to clients and internal teams throughout the entire lifecycle of Oracle CPQ implementation and integration projects.
* Conduct thorough testing, troubleshooting, and performance optimization to ensure the stability, reliability, and scalability of Oracle CPQ solutions.
* Develop and maintain custom scripts, business rules, and workflows within Oracle CPQ to automate critical business processes and enhance user experience.
* Provide comprehensive technical guidance and support to clients and internal teams throughout the entire lifecycle of Oracle CPQ implementation and integration projects.
* Proficiency in Oracle CPQ APIs, BML/BMQL for complex use cases.
* Experience on Javascript and CSS for BML UI and libraries
* Hands on experience with Oracle CPQ product configuration, constraint rules, pricing rules, and discounting mechanisms.
* Familiarity with document design and template creation within Oracle CPQ for generating quotes, proposals, and contracts.
* Knowledge of CPQ integration methodologies, including web services, REST APIs, and middleware platforms
* Strong communication skills with others at all levels of the organization - ability to collaborate with IT and business to derive the requirements and spec out a solution.
* Ability to work in a large, global corporate structure.
* Can-do attitude who seeks, obtains, and applies new knowledge/skills.
* Demonstrated ability to clearly isolate and define problems, effectively evaluate alternative solutions, and make decisions in a timely manner.
* Willingness to travel both domestically and internationally to support global implementations.

**PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS:**

* Advanced degree
* Experience with Oracle EBS 12.2.4 or higher, Oracle Cloud
* Professional skills, written technical concepts.
* Able to resolve conflict efficiently.
* Works with multiple cross-functional projects
* Drives process mapping sessions

**Our Commitment to Our People**

Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: Sustainability is no small ambition. That’s why everything we do is geared toward a sustainable future—for our generation and all those to come. Through groundbreaking innovations, HVACR technology and cold chain solutions, we are reducing carbon emissions and improving energy efficiency in spaces of all sizes, from residential to commercial to industrial.

Our employees are our greatest strength. We believe that our culture of passion, openness, and collaboration empowers us to work toward the same goal - to make the world a better place. We invest in the end-to-end development of our people, beginning at onboarding and through senior leadership, so they can thrive personally and professionally.

Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer the right options to meet your individual/family needs . We provide employees with flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

Together, we have the opportunity – and the power – to continue to revolutionize the technology behind air conditioning, heating and refrigeration, and cultivate a better future. Learn more about us and how you can join our team!

**Our Commitment to Inclusion & Belonging**

At Copeland, we cultivate a strong sense of inclusion and belonging where individuals of all backgrounds, and with diverse perspectives, are embraced and treated fairly to enable a stronger workforce. Our employee resource groups play an important role in culture and community building at Copeland.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Copeland is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.
