title: 2025 - Early Career, Underwriting Analyst - United States, Multiple Locations
description:
AIG is reimagining the way we help customers manage risk. Join us as an Underwriting Analyst to play your part in that transformation with opportunities to learn and grow your skills and experience as a valued member of the team.

**About Us**

At AIG, helping organizations and people discover new potential is our purpose. As a global risk leader, we do this for our clients every day. Through our deep expertise in their industries and our innovative solutions that help them smartly manage risk, we enable their growth in ways they never thought possible.

But we also do the same thing for our colleagues, because we know our people are our greatest strength – the source of every insight, every idea and every innovation. When we're working as one team to do what's right for our colleagues and our communities, we can achieve excellence together. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.

**Make your mark in Underwriting**

AIG is a leading provider of insurance products and services in approximately 190 countries and jurisdictions – focused on helping to manage risk for commercial and personal customers. We offer a broad range of products through a diversified, multi-channel distribution network, including one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks.

AIG Underwriting teams help to find insurance solutions in areas including Financial Lines, Property, Casualty, Specialty Lines, Cyber, and Multinational Clients. We are reimagining how we help customers to manage risk, transforming our operating model and reshaping our role responsibilities and career pathways. The goal is to unlock the full potential in each colleague – empowering our people to grow as insurance professionals and add more value to our customers and AIG.

**How you will make an impact**

When you join AIG, you will be part of a connected cohort community of early career talent participating in a program that equips you with learning experiences and skills needed to launch your career. From day one, you will develop your knowledge and understanding of AIG and the insurance industry and learn new skills through meaningful on-the-job experiences and instructor-led masterclasses. Through exposure to senior leaders, mentoring circles, networking and volunteering, you will build connections with colleagues across the organization. Collectively, these different experiences are designed to enable you to make an impact and build a rewarding and successful career.

**What you’ll need to succeed**

AIG seeks candidates who have excelled in previous work experience, demonstrated outstanding academic and extracurricular achievement, possess strong analytical, quantitative and interpersonal skills, and are enthusiastic about the insurance industry.

We also look for a diverse background of experience, culture and thought. Successful candidates typically have a global perspective and a team-oriented track record.

**Required**

Candidate for Bachelor's or Master's degree to be received no later than June 2025 (unofficial transcript required upon application).

**Program Start Date**

The Early Career Analyst program will start on July 28, 2025.

**Locations**

Early Career Analyst positions are in-person opportunities and are available nationwide. When we work in the office, we experience greater connections with opportunities to collaborate, innovate and learn together.

The base salary range for this position is $58,500 - $78,000. However, the final base salary offered to a candidate may be higher or lower than the range depending on a number of factors, including the candidate’s specific work location.

**Ready to make change happen?**

We would love to hear from you. To be considered, an online application, including a resume, is required. Please apply at www.aig.com/campus.

At AIG, we value in-person collaboration as a vital part of our culture, which is why we ask our team members to be primarily in the office. This approach helps us work together effectively and create a supportive, connected environment for our team and clients alike.

**Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters**

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.

**Welcome to a culture of** **inclusion**

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The talent of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com .

Functional Area:

UW - Underwriting

title: Property Analyst - Level 2
description:
**Job ID:** 693977BR
  
**Date posted:** May. 15, 2025  
  
**Description:****Property Analyst**  
  
**Location: Fort Worth TX**  
  
**What You Will Be Doing**  
Join a mission-driven team at Lockheed Martin Aeronautics as a Property Analyst in Fort Worth, Texas, where your work will directly contribute to the success of cutting-edge defense programs. In this role, you'll bring your supply chain expertise and analytical mindset to ensure the accuracy and reliability of supply data that supports operational readiness and mission success. You'll partner with cross-functional teams, apply advanced analytics, and help optimize product support and logistics performance in a high-impact environment.  
  
**Key Responsibilities**  

* Use advanced analytics to support supply requirements and product support planning.

  

* Ensure data accuracy and reduce inconsistencies to drive dependable decision-making.

  

* Collaborate across engineering, logistics, and program teams to maximize mission readiness and fleet availability.

  

* Leverage supply chain and logistics knowledge to identify areas for operational improvement.

  

* Resolve complex challenges using innovative and practical problem-solving strategies.

  

* Provide subject matter expertise in asset and inventory management practices.

  

* Track, manage, and report on key supply performance metrics and data integrity.

  

* Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across supply chain operations.

  
**What's In It For You**

title: Senior Catastrophe Risk Analyst
description:
**Make your mark in Catastrophe Risk Management**

The North American Catastrophe Risk Management team is responsible for catastrophe modelling and portfolio exposure management for AIG’s North American Insurance businesses. Effective Catastrophe Management is integral to the success of the business and our catastrophe modelers play a critical role in managing our global risk appetite. Day to day pricing and portfolio roll-up is carried out at our Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Bangalore, India. The North American Catastrophe Risk Management team is part of a wider Global Underwriting Analytics team with individuals located across the US, and in London and Singapore.

The primary responsibility for the individual in this role is to be the catastrophe modelling business partner for AIG’s Retail Property business, and other select portfolios in North America. The role requires a technically proficient catastrophe modeler with experience of developing or a desire to develop strong relationships with underwriters and underwriting portfolio managers. The role requires core competencies in catastrophe portfolio modelling whilst also providing the chance to get involved in wider analytics strategies including business planning, portfolio optimization, and technical tool development.

**How you will create an impact**

* Own the relationship between the catastrophe modelling team and the Retail Property Underwriting team, providing advice and data driven insights that will support Underwriting and Portfolio Management.
* Lead the quarterly portfolio roll-up and reporting operations for select North American Commercial, and Specialty portfolios.
* Work closely with actuarial, claims, and other functions, integrating catastrophe modelling insights into day-to-day business, and portfolio optimization strategies.
* Carry out other modelling business activities including event response, business planning, budgeting, profit studies, portfolio optimization, reinsurance purchasing, and other exercises where catastrophe risk inputs are required.
* Support internal partners as needed to respond to rating agency surveys, regulatory filing, data calls and other ad-hoc reporting, for various U.S. state and national insurance regulatory bodies.
* Be a best practices expert for Underwriting Teams, the CoE, and operational groups across the company. Proactively review and propose new or changes to, and play a key role in developing our systems, processes, and strategies

* Continuously engage with the wider Catastrophe Risk Management & Underwriting Analytics teams, supporting ad-hoc analytics projects and contributing to wider analytics initiatives

**What you'll need to succeed**

* 5+ Years of catastrophe portfolio modelling experience, preferably using RMS and/or AIR.
* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
* A strong understanding of property insurance and reinsurance. Progress towards industry qualifications (e.g. CPCU) would be a bonus.
* A high degree of attention to detail and an ability to manage multiple global projects with competing priorities
* Excellent SQL skills and an understanding of data back-end schema is a must. Technical proficiency in and additional programming language such as R or Python would be a bonus.
* An ability to communicate technical concepts in a non-technical manner, to a wide range of audiences
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

Ready to take your career to the next level? We would love to hear from you!

For positions based in NYC, NY the base salary range is $81,000 - 109,000 and for position based in Illinois, the base salary range is $84,000-$111,500 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. In addition, we’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits, a summary of which can be viewed here: US Benefits Overview .

#LI-HB1

At AIG, we value in-person collaboration as a vital part of our culture, which is why we ask our team members to be primarily in the office. This approach helps us work together effectively and create a supportive, connected environment for our team and clients alike.

**Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters**

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.

**Welcome to a culture of** **inclusion**

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The talent of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com .

title: GenAI User Experience Researcher
description:
**GenAI User Experience Researcher**

**Be part of something groundbreaking**

At AIG, we are making long-term investments in a brand-new, **innovative Generative AI team** , designed to explore new possibilities for how artificial intelligence can be applied in insurance and beyond, and we need your help.

With the support and investment needed to explore new frontiers in generative AI, you’ll be working alongside talented colleagues, innovating and leading projects that will transform how we manage risk and serve our customers.

This team is central to our vision of the future and the core of our business offering. We will incorporate best-in-class engineering and product management principles, and your guidance and collaboration will be critical to its success. To rapidly advance and innovate, we need your skills and expertise to build world-class products. If you’re excited by the opportunity to create meaningful impact at scale, we’d love to hear from you.

**Who we are**

AIG is a leading global insurance organization providing a wide range of property casualty insurance and other financial services. We provide world-class products and expertise to businesses and individuals in approximately 190 countries and jurisdictions.

At AIG, we’re reshaping how the world manages risk, and we’re inviting you to be a key part of that transformation. As a GenAI UX Researcher you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact, leveraging and further developing your skills to guide groundbreaking AI initiatives. If you’re looking for a place to grow your career and where your contributions will shape the future, AIG is where you belong.

**How you will create impact:**

As a GenAI UX Researcher at AIG, you will actively seek user insights that shape product decisions through the continuous discovery of user behaviors, needs, and motivations. The ideal candidate will collaborate with business stakeholders, product owners/analysts, designers, and developers to ensure our GenAI solutions are valuable, easy to use, and deliver meaningful business outcomes.

With your expertise, we’ll transform how user-centered practices and data driven innovation, create smarter, more efficient, personalized solutions that set new standards for the industry.

**Your responsibilities include:**

* Lead and execute comprehensive research initiatives in the GenAI product space using “mixed methods” of qualitative and quantitative research approaches to gain a comprehensive understanding of user experiences.
* Synthesize complex research data into actionable insights that inform product strategy and delivery.
* Work with Product Design Strategists, Designers, and Product Leaders to deeply understand the needs of our user base to identify opportunities to address those needs through innovative solutions.
* The presentation to research findings to product leadership and key stakeholders.
* Communicating insights through the creation of experience maps, user journeys, service blueprints or similar visualization to communicate the customer context.
* Collaboration with product and data sciences teams to develop measurement frameworks that measure product value on an ongoing basis.
* Facilitation of various workshop formats to support research planning and discovery, insights synthesis, co-creation, and stakeholder alignment.
* Sharing subject matter expertise to regularly enhance product training and team skills development.

**What is needed to be successful:**

* 5+ year of experience designing and conducting UX research in a digital product organization.
* Demonstrated expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research methodologies
* Experience with rapid experimentation and prototyping
* Excellence in research synthesis and the compelling presentation of findings
* Track record of influencing product decisions through research insights
* A deep working knowledge of Figma and the ability to fully leverage the platform for UX research and associated deliverables.
* Experience delivering insights to inform feature prioritization aligned to user needs, commercial, and strategic priorities.
* Experience with industry standard UX tools and data analytics methods required for analysis.
* You are collaborative and have experience working with cross-functional product teams.
* Experience working with agile at scale development methodologies.
* Ability to excel in a fast-paced, service-oriented environment through excellent time management skills.
* You are self-motivated with a strong capacity for independent initiative and creative problem-solving.
* You can demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills to convey thought leadership and influence senior executives.

**It would be nice if...**

* You have experience in financial services or insurance.
* You have experience conducting research for enterprise grade software platforms.
* You are passionate about innovation and new technologies, specifically the use GenAI in the UX research discipline.

title: IT Asset Management Analyst
description:
***Please do not respond to direct messages with your personal information. All job applications and your sensitive, personal information should only be submitted via our official job platform.***

**Job Title: IT Asset Management Analyst** (onsite)

**Location:** US-SC- Greenville (Sandy Springs)

**FLSA**: Exempt

#LI-Onsite

**Job Overview**:

We are seeking an experienced IT Asset Management Analyst with a strong background in IT Support, Power BI, and metadata tracking to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of experience in IT asset management and analytics, with a proven ability to optimize processes, drive data-driven insights, and support IT operations.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* **IT Asset Lifecycle Management:** Oversee the tracking, management, and optimization of IT hardware and software assets throughout their lifecycle. Ensure inventory accuracy and compliance with licensing agreements.
* **Metadata Tracking:** Implement processes for capturing, managing, and maintaining metadata related to IT assets, ensuring enriched data organization and visibility.
* **Data Analytics and Reporting:** Leverage Power BI to design dashboards and reports, delivering actionable insights on IT asset utilization, lifecycle, and costs.
* **IT Support Collaboration:** Partner with IT support teams to address asset-related concerns, optimize resource allocation, and improve service quality.
* **Vendor Management**: Work closely with vendors to negotiate contracts, monitor warranties, and ensure the timely delivery of IT resources.
* **Audit and Compliance:** Perform regular audits of IT assets to ensure compliance with policies and regulations, addressing discrepancies proactively.
* **Process Optimization:** Refine and improve processes for IT asset procurement, deployment, and retirement to enhance efficiency and reduce operational costs.
* **Documentation Management:** Maintain detailed records of IT assets, metadata, workflows, and contracts, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for stakeholders.

*The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities.*

**Job Requirements:**

* 5-7 years of relevant experience in IT asset management, IT support, and analytics.
* Expertise in Power BI for visualization and analytics. Familiarity with IT asset management tools and metadata tracking processes.
* Strong understanding of IT asset lifecycle management, procurement processes, and support operations.
* Proven ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and implement data-driven improvements.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of interfacing across departments and with external vendors
* Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field (preferred).
* Familiarity with ITIL or similar frameworks for IT service management.
* Experience with automation or scripting for asset and metadata management.
* Knowledge of compliance standards like ISO 27001.

**Company Benefits:**

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Flexible Spending Account
* Health Savings Account
* 401(k) Plan with Company Match
* Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Company-paid Life Insurance
* Paid Holidays and Vacation
* Employee Referral Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Wellness Programs
* Paid Community Service Opportunities
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Ongoing Training & Personal Development
* And More!

**About Safe-Guard Products International:**

Safe-Guard serves Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), top retailers, and independent agents in the automotive finance and insurance industry with the leading Protection Products Platform. Our platform delivers innovative protection products and solutions that protect consumers from the perils of ownership, while providing Finance &Insurance professionals the tools to ignite scalable and sustainable business growth. Safe-Guard’s success is driven by over 850 employees, who serve more than 12,000 dealers and support contract holders across the U.S. and Canada.

For 30 years and counting, our team continues to transform the motor vehicle space, earning a stellar reputation from our partners and peers by providing: 1) the highest quality protection products in the industry, 2) a broad platform of branded product, technology, marketing, and training solutions, and 3) an unwavering commitment to uncomplicated care and customer service.

*Safe-Guard Products International is an equal opportunity employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, disability or protected veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.*

title: Manager - Data Operations - Finance & Clinical Operations
description:
### **Description**

We are seeking a highly skilled **Manager - Data Operations** to lead reporting and dashboard development for Finance, Clinical Operations, and Customer Service at Astrana Health. This role will be responsible for managing data-driven insights that support financial analytics such as FP&A, clinical operations, and service performance metrics. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, reporting automation, and business intelligence tools.  
  
Our Values:

* *Put Patients First*
* *Empower Entrepreneurial Provider and Care Teams*
* *Operate with Integrity & Excellence*
* *Be Innovative*
* *Work As One Team*

  

### **What You'll Do**

  

* **Data Reporting & Dashboard Development:** Build and maintain dashboards that provide key insights into, financial performance, revenue cycle, and operational efficiencies. Ensure reporting is accurate, timely, and actionable.
* **Finance & Claims Analytics:** Develop reporting solutions that track profit and loss
* **Operational Performance Monitoring:** Identify trends and inefficiencies in claims processing, customer service response times, and clinical operations to support data-driven decision-making.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Work closely with Finance, Clinical Ops, and Customer Service leadership to translate data insights into strategic initiatives.
* **Data Management & Integrity:** Oversee data collection, validation, and processing to ensure high-quality and consistent reporting across departments.
* **Technology & Tools:** Utilize SQL, Python, Power BI, and cloud platforms to build scalable and automated reporting solutions.
* **Process Improvement:** Identify opportunities to optimize data workflows and reporting structures for efficiency and accuracy.
* **Team Leadership:** Mentor analysts, ensuring best practices in data governance and reporting methodologies.

  

### **Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, analytics, statistics, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.
* Strong SQL proficiency and intermediate Python knowledge; experience with C, C++, Java, and/or PySpark is a plus.
* Knowledge of software engineering best practices, including version control, SDLC, and code reviews.
* Experience working with large datasets and cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Azure.
* Experience in healthcare analytics, claims data, financial reporting, or operational performance measurement.
* Familiarity with database management systems such as MongoDB or Microsoft SQL Server.
* Experience with business intelligence or visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
* Strong written and oral communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

**You're great for this role if you have:**

* 4+ years of experience in data analytics and reporting.
* 3+ years of programming experience using version control and contributing to data projects.
* Experience in healthcare finance, claims analytics, or operational performance reporting.

  

### **Environmental Job Requirements and Working Conditions**

  

* This position is remotely based in the U.S.
* The target pay range for this role is: $120,000 - $140,000**.** This range represents our national target for this role.

Astrana Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. If you require assistance in applying for open positions due to a disability, please email us at humanresourcesdept@astranahealth.com to request an accommodation.  
  
Additional Information:

The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.

### **About Astrana Health, Inc.**

Astrana Health (NASDAQ: ASTH) is a physician-centric, technology-powered healthcare management company. We are building and operating a novel, integrated, value-based healthcare delivery platform to empower our physicians to provide the highest quality of end-to-end care for their patients in a cost-effective manner. Our mission is to combine our clinical experience, best-in-class delivery network, and technological expertise to improve patient outcomes, increase access to healthcare, and make the US healthcare system more efficient.

Our platform currently empowers over 10,000 physicians to provide care for over 1 million patients nationwide. Our rapid growth and unique position at the intersection of all major healthcare stakeholders (payer, provider, and patient) gives us an unparalleled opportunity to combine clinical and technological expertise to improve patient outcomes, increase access to quality healthcare, and reduce the waste in the US healthcare system.

title: GenAI Product Analyst
description:
**GenAI Product Analyst**

**Be part of something groundbreaking**

At AIG, we are making long-term investments in a brand-new, **innovative Generative AI team** , designed to explore new possibilities for how artificial intelligence can be applied in insurance and beyond, and we need your help.

With the support and investment needed to explore new frontiers in generative AI, you’ll be working alongside talented colleagues, innovating and leading projects that will transform how we manage risk and serve our customers.

At AIG, we’re reshaping how the world manages risk, and we’re inviting you to be a key part of that transformation. As a GenAI Product Analyst you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact, leveraging and further developing your skills to guide groundbreaking AI initiatives. If you’re looking for a place to grow your career and where your contributions will shape the future, AIG is where you belong.

As a GenAI Product Analyst at AIG, you will support the development and delivery of innovative AI solutions, helping AIG to become a leader in applying Generative AI to solve complex business challenges. This is an exciting opportunity to shape a newly formed team with the resources and support to explore fresh, creative approaches. With your expertise, we’ll transform how data drives innovation, creating smarter, more efficient, and personalized solutions that set new standards for the industry.

* Conduct research to identify user personas, pain points, and journeys & analyze this information (A/B testing, concept testing, data analysis) to inform product development.

  You have experience with agile at scale development methodologies

title: Senior Social Analytics Manager, Amazon MGM Studios
description:
- 6+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
- Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
- Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data
- Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs
- Experience communicating results to senior leadership
- Experience presenting metrics and progress to goal to senior leadership
- 4+ years of experience in a social, marketing, or business analytics role
  
Amazon MGM Studios is the home for talent, creating and producing Original films and television series for a global audience. Original series premiere exclusively on Prime Video, which is available in more than 240 countries and territories worldwide. Amazon MGM Studios also produces and acquires Original movies for theatrical release and exclusively for Prime Video.
As the Senior Social Analytics Manager at Amazon MGM Studios, you will spearhead the evolution of social media measurement and insights and unlocking insights that drive strategic business decisions. This role offers the unique opportunity to shape entertainment marketing strategy while working with prestigious IPs and innovative minds in the industry.
Working cross-functionally with internal and external stakeholders, this role will balance effective program management with day-to-day ownership of social data to drive insights and actions. The successful candidate will lead global social analytics and research work, focusing on assessing and auditing our social media presence globally, supporting program creation for audience engagement, and measuring success in strengthening Amazon's brand.
The ideal candidate is a builder who excels at distilling complex data into distinct, clear strategies. As a natural analyst, you are detail-oriented and possess expertise in social media analysis with a passion for delivering actionable insights to key stakeholders. You are proficient with business intelligence and social analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Sprinklr, Meltwater) and can partner with business leaders to deep-dive into data to solve complex business problems. You understand social media landscapes and can combine good judgment with data to guide channel strategy. Being analytical, organized, curious, and able to work backwards from business problems is essential, along with strong cross-team coordination, project management, and writing skills. This role reports into the Head of Social Strategy and Operations in the Amazon MGM Studios Social and Influencer team.
Key job responsibilities
- Own and evolve global measurement framework for our global tentpoles and social priority titles
- Build and maintain dynamic dashboards and reporting processes to effectively track and communicate performance metrics internally
- Oversee managed services agency relationship, operationalizing their scope to optimize reporting capabilities and ensure alignment with team needs
- Translate key business questions related to audience, content, or channel into research and analysis, defining the sets of data required for each project
- Manage the team's goal setting/tracking program, and present results to senior leaders
- Counsel social media managers on how to tell a story with data, which metrics to prioritize, and how to draw insights from data
- Lead social listening efforts to better understand our audiences and key communications topics.
- Work cross-functionally with other analytics, reporting, and research teams to develop and share best practices and learnings, define and refine benchmarks, and develop best-in-class insights
- Proactively identify and implement process improvements to streamline reporting workflows, enhance data visualization, and increase operational efficiency
- Drive innovation in reporting methodologies to ensure deliverables are actionable, digestible, and impactful for stakeholders
- Be resourceful and creative to overcome obstacles and turn challenges into opportunities
  

* Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
* Experience translating data into insights, preferably with a focus in marketing or social media

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  
  
Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company’s reputation. Pursuant to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.  
  
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $112,800/year in our lowest geographic market up to $186,500/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: 2025 - Early Career, Underwriting Analyst - Miami Office
description:
AIG is reimagining the way we help customers manage risk. Join us as an Underwriting Analyst to play your part in that transformation with opportunities to learn and grow your skills and experience as a valued member of the team.

**About Us**

At AIG, helping organizations and people discover new potential is our purpose. As a global risk leader, we do this for our clients every day. Through our deep expertise in their industries and our innovative solutions that help them smartly manage risk, we enable their growth in ways they never thought possible.

But we also do the same thing for our colleagues, because we know our people are our greatest strength – the source of every insight, every idea and every innovation. When we're working as one team to do what's right for our colleagues and our communities, we can achieve excellence together. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.

**Make your mark in Underwriting**

AIG is a leading provider of insurance products and services in approximately 190 countries and jurisdictions – focused on helping to manage risk for commercial and personal customers. We offer a broad range of products through a diversified, multi-channel distribution network, including one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks.

AIG Underwriting teams help to find insurance solutions in areas including Financial Lines, Property, Casualty, Specialty Lines, Cyber, and Multinational Clients. We are reimagining how we help customers to manage risk, transforming our operating model and reshaping our role responsibilities and career pathways. The goal is to unlock the full potential in each colleague – empowering our people to grow as insurance professionals and add more value to our customers and AIG.

**How you will make an impact**

When you join AIG, you will be part of a connected cohort community of early career talent participating in a program that equips you with learning experiences and skills needed to launch your career. From day one, you will develop your knowledge and understanding of AIG and the insurance industry and learn new skills through meaningful on-the-job experiences and instructor-led masterclasses. Through exposure to senior leaders, mentoring circles, networking and volunteering, you will build connections with colleagues across the organization. Collectively, these different experiences are designed to enable you to make an impact and build a rewarding and successful career.

**What you’ll need to succeed**

AIG seeks candidates who have excelled in previous work experience, demonstrated outstanding academic and extracurricular achievement, possess strong analytical, quantitative and interpersonal skills, and are enthusiastic about the insurance industry.

We also look for a diverse background of experience, culture and thought. Successful candidates typically have a global perspective and a team-oriented track record.

**Required**

Candidate for Bachelor's or Master's degree to be received no later than June 2025 (unofficial transcript required upon application). Excellent communication skills in English and Spanish, including verbal and written.

**Program Start Date**

The Early Career Analyst program will start on July 28, 2025.

**Locations**

Early Career Analyst positions are in-person opportunities and are available the Miami office. When we work in the office, we experience greater connections with opportunities to collaborate, innovate and learn together.

The base salary range for this position is $58,500 - $78,000. However, the final base salary offered to a candidate may be higher or lower than the range depending on a number of factors, including the candidate’s specific work location.

**Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters**

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.

**Reimagining insurance to make a bigger difference to the world**

American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a global leader in commercial and personal insurance solutions; we are one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. It is an exciting time to join us — across our operations, we are thinking in new and innovative ways to deliver ever-better solutions to our customers. At AIG, you can go further to support individuals, businesses, and communities, helping them to manage risk, respond to times of uncertainty and discover new potential. We invest in our largest asset, our people, through continuous learning and development, in a culture that celebrates everyone for who they are and what they want to become.

**Welcome to a culture of belonging**

We’re committed to creating a culture that truly respects and celebrates each other’s talents, backgrounds, cultures, opinions and goals. We foster a culture of inclusion and belonging through our flexible work arrangements, diversity and inclusion learning, cultural awareness activities and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs). With global chapters, ERGs are a cornerstone for our culture of inclusion. The diversity of our people is one of AIG’s greatest assets, and we are honored that our drive for positive change has been recognized by numerous recent awards and accreditations.

*AIG provides equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.*

AIG is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants and employees with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation, please send an email to candidatecare@aig.com .

title: Early Career - Distribution Analyst
description:
The Early Career role will be an ideal opportunity to develop your experience and expertise in Insurance.

AIG General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services – focused on helping to manage risk for commercial and personal customers. We offer a broad range of products through a diversified, multi-channel distribution network, including one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks.

At AIG, we are constantly working to ensure that all employees have the training and skills they need to have a rewarding and successful career. Designed with that commitment at its core, our globally centralized Early Career program provides a platform for participants to launch or accelerate their careers. Through a range of approaches including innovative experiential learning and technical training, performance assessments, formalized mentoring, and exposure to senior leaders, our Early Career program offers unparalleled development opportunities for our diverse early career talent.

The program is designed to evolve with the rapid pace of technological advancements and changing employee preferences to ensure that today’s participants become leaders capable of conquering tomorrow’s challenges.

Over the two-year duration of the program, successful candidates will work in a dynamic environment combining formal and experience-based training alongside meaningful and rewarding work experience. Then, guided by experienced professionals, they will put the skills they learn into practice in a supportive corporate environment.

This position will commence in July 2025 and will be based in Hato Rey, Puerto Rico.

**Make your mark in Distribution Team**

AIG Distribution Team help to maintain and develop business relationship with appointed agents and other related business partners in order to find insurance solutions for our main producers and their clients.

**How you will create an impact**

As a Distribution/Sales Analyst, you will work closely with the Puerto Rico Distribution Team as well as the Cluster Executive Management team and support them in their line of work. The PR Distribution team is primarily co-responsible for our major customers, global and local broker relationships and larger cross-product collaborations across the Puerto Rico cluster. This role will give you an opportunity to both join a global graduate program and gain valuable learning experience and as well as be part of a cluster distribution operation that will give you valuable Puerto Rico commercial insurance experience. A selection of the things you will do:

* Supporting the implementation of the Distribution Strategy
* Coordinate Distribution activities and work closely with the Client & Broker Executives
* Support in analyzing trends and support the broader team in various administrative tasks

Our early careers will:

* Help you gain insight into our industry and work culture while delivering valuable real-world experience in a collaborative environment.
* Learn firsthand what it's like to work in an environment dedicated to exceeding expectations by delivering products and services tailored to the unique needs of our clients.
* Understand the company’s operation procedure and ensure the operation appropriately.
* Help you to grow as insurance professionals and add more value to our customers and AIG.

**What you’ll need to succeed**

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Communication skills and teamwork driven
* Highly responsible, resilient and self-driven
* Passion on innovation
* Focus on solving problems
* Leadership skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Programs: Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
* Bilingual (English and Spanish): Written/Spoken/Communicating

At AIG, we are reimagining the way we help customers to manage risk. Join us as a Distribution/Commercial Early Career to play your part in that transformation. It’s an opportunity to grow your skills and experience as a valued member of the team. This Distribution/Commercial Early Career role will be an ideal opportunity to develop your experience and expertise in Commercial skills in the Insurance Industry.

**Enjoy benefits that take care of what matters**

At AIG, our people are our greatest asset. We know how important it is to protect and invest in what’s most important to you. That is why we created our Total Rewards Program, a comprehensive benefits package that extends beyond time spent at work to offer benefits focused on your health, wellbeing and financial security—as well as your professional development—to bring peace of mind to you and your family.

title: Consumer Insights Manager
description:
**Sazerac Company Overview**
Build your career at Sazerac! With almost 400 years of rich history, Sazerac Company has thrived as an independent, American family-owned company with operations in the United States and around the world. Since the 2000s, Sazerac has averaged double digit growth every year! Sazerac Company produces and markets the most award-winning bourbons and whiskeys in the world, including Buffalo Trace, Pappy Van Winkle, Eagle Rare, Blanton’s, Traveller, and Sazerac Rye. Additionally, Sazerac owns many popular brands across a range of spirits, including Fireball, Svedka, Wheatley, BuzzBallz, Southern Comfort, Seagram’s V.O., Myers’s, Goldschläger, Parrot Bay, 99 Brand, and Platinum Vodka.
  
  
We’re proud of our award-winning culture and distilleries. Our Louisville office has been named one of the “Best Places to Work in Kentucky” four times, and our Buffalo Trace Distillery has earned the title of “world’s most award-winning distillery” through the dedication of our craftsmen for well over 200 years. Whether you’re a recent graduate or an experienced professional, Sazerac provides extraordinary opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, entrepreneurial industry.
  
  
**Job Description/Responsibilities**
**Bio**
: The US Insights Manager (Marketing/Consumer) works with US brand teams to develop insights and answer consumer questions to help grow our brands in the US. Need to proactively identify consumer insights for Sazerac priority brands and BevAlc categories through the integration of consumer data, primary research, market data, and consumer trends to derive insights from the collective data set and translate them into actionable growth opportunities via brand renovation, expansion, NBD, and marketing commercialization.
  
  

* Align individual priorities, time, and resource allocation by brand, country, and state. Support the marketing team with market analysis, insight generation, and opportunity identification for BCSPs. Provide insights to fuel compelling presentations to help secure customer and distributor support.
* Support Global Insights Managers and business leaders to establish best practice approaches in consumer research, insight generation, and strategy development. Facilitates adoption of research methodologies and suppliers, continuous improvement in techniques and cost, and seeks new tools to increase effectiveness.
* Leads the sourcing, interpretation, and application of marketplace and consumer learning and trends to influence category and brand strategies, brand standards, new business development, sales decks, and marketing communication (packaging and programming). Day-to-day contact with research suppliers and communication with internal clients. Contributes to creating learning plans and drives an agile, analytically-driven approach to identifying and defining business opportunities for growth; Executes learning plans, communicating effectively and delivering actionable business recommendations on time and within budget.
* Establish well-organized priorities for yourself. Document project workflows when establishing new, best-practice project workflows to facilitate future training and the scalability of the process for the team and organization.
* Support the development of materials for customer presentations and distributor reviews with insights.
* Develop and follow an action plan to gain the learning experiences needed to advance my career.
* Contribute to Sazerac's fiscal year growth by establishing himself/herself as a business partner and translating insights and analytics into top- and bottom-line business impact. This person analyzes consumer, market, and brand health data. This role will also conduct primary consumer research and establish foundational consumer research to define Sazerac brands' growth opportunities related to brand renovation, expansion, new business development, and marketing strategy, domestically and globally.
* Utilize the PDS system to identify areas for self-improvement, measure skill improvement progress, improve job effectiveness, and achieve goals. Actively participate in improving skills and documenting learning within the PDS system.

**Qualifications/Requirements**
**To Be SUCCESSFUL in the role, you’ll need these requirements**

* Bachelor's Degree in Business or commensurate experience
* 3+ years of experience in Consumer Insights
* Experience handling and analyzing consumer survey data sets using tools such as SPSS, uTab, Minitab, etc.
* Ability to manage multiple projects at one time
* Excellent oral & written communication skills
* Working knowledge of MS Office Products (Word, Excel and Outlook)
* Strong analytical and technical skills
* Willingness to travel
* Ability to quickly learn new systems/processes
* Ability to quickly learn new systems/processes
* Demonstrate the ability to work as a team as well as self-directed
* Experience with MS Power BI
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to work with international colleagues in different time zones

**Preferred**

* Ability to communicate with all levels of an org
* Experience in Alcohol Beverage Industry or CPG overall

**Physical Requirements**

* Strong communication skills

**Compensation**
: Placement within the salary range is calculated based on years of directly relatable experience for the position. T he salary range refers to base salary only and does not include car allowance, annual bonus, fuel, or cell phone reimbursement.
  
  
**Culture And Benefits**
A career at Sazerac offers you the opportunity to reach your full potential as part of a creative, decisive, high-performance team. Sazerac values the needs and wants of our team members and offers inclusive benefits to attract and retain the best talent. Our culture is built upon the values of hard work, diligence and personal responsibility.
  
  
**Sazerac Team Members Enjoy**

* Competitive Pay
* Comprehensive Benefits from Day One including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.
* Family Coverage: Options to cover family members, including domestic partners.
* 401(k) Plan: Immediate access to a matching 401(k) plan.
* Flexible Time Away: Enjoy paid time off (PTO), holidays, and parental leave.
* Mental Health and Wellness: Access to mental health care and wellness incentive programs.
* Educational Support: Benefit from tuition reimbursement and our scholarship program for dependents of Sazerac team members.
* Fun Extras: Enjoy branded apparel, fun events, and a team member bottle purchase program.
* Training and Development: Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Benefits, salary range, and programs may vary by role or location. For roles within our commercial team - the Salary range refers to base salary only and does not include car allowance, annual bonus, fuel or cell phone reimbursement. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package. Sazerac is committed to equality of opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, veteran status, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability or any other legally protected status.
  
  
**Min**
USD $84,602.00/Yr.
  
  
**Max**
USD $126,903.00/Yr.

title: Director, Research and Insights
description:
**Description**

WorldatWork is a global non-profit organization dedicated to serving, educating, and inspiring those who reward and engage the workforce. Our members include business professionals who are accountable for the critically important practices of compensation, well-being, benefits, development, and recognition programs within their companies around the world. Over 93% of the global 500 organizations are among the many customers we have served over the last 70 years.

**Position Purpose:**

This role leads the strategy, execution, and delivery of both market and topical research to provide evidence-based insights that drive business decisions and innovations. The Director oversees quantitative and qualitative research projects that support WorldatWork's internal goals (market and customer experience research) and provide valuable insights for the total rewards and HR professions (topical research).

**Primary Responsibilities:**

Primary responsibilities include:

* Lead and develop a team of research analysts and external partners to enhance research capabilities.
* Manage research budgets, timelines, and vendor relationships effectively.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, content, events, and other departments to align research projects with business needs.
* Oversee concurrent data collection projects, ensuring proper scheduling, resource allocation, and vendor/partner coordination.
* Conduct and oversee both qualitative and quantitative research, including surveys, focus groups, interviews, data analysis and reporting.
* Ensure effective presentation of research data, including the conceptualization and design of charts, infographics, and reports.
* Write or oversee the creation of narrative analyses to explain research results for use in reports, briefs, articles, and other content.

Market/CX Research:

* Develop and implement comprehensive market research strategies that align with WorldatWork’s business goals.
* Present actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership, supporting product development, marketing, and growth strategies.

Topical Research:

* Manage a dynamic topical research program, adapting projects to meet evolving content and delivery needs, while aligning with organizational priorities.
* Partner with internal and external experts (practitioners, consultants, and academics) to extract key findings and real-world applications from research results.
* Lead the creation of derivative content, such as press releases, articles, presentations, and multimedia based on topical research findings.
* Drive the transition from traditional research reporting to interactive, web-native deliverables, including revenue-generating enhancements.

Essential responsibilities include:

N/A

***\\*Individuals may perform other duties as assigned, including work in other functional areas to cover absences or relief, to equalize peak work periods, or otherwise to contribute to the organization when needed.***

**Qualifications:**

* MBA or Master’s in a research-related field strongly preferred; bachelor’s degree required.
* Minimum 5 years of experience leading research projects and teams.
* Proven ability to manage research projects from inception to completion, including scoping, design, execution, quality control, and presentation.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**

* Demonstrated success in leading research teams and delivering meaningful results.
* Strong organizational and time management skills to handle large-scale or competing projects.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to identify key variables, spot patterns, and develop quick, data-driven solutions.
* Expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research methods, with proficiency in relevant data analysis tools.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
* Strong leadership and project management capabilities.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Familiarity with total rewards practices and terminology to communicate effectively with professionals in the field.
* Knowledge of emerging tools and methodologies in market research.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* Manages Research team

At WorldatWork, we offer a competitive and comprehensive total rewards package. The hiring range for this position is $150,000 to $170,000 plus eligibility for an annual discretionary bonus with a target of 15% of base salary. This position may be worked remotely. The benefits for this position include ongoing professional development training opportunities, health, dental, vision, well-being, health savings, flexible spending, retirement, and annual discretionary bonus. For a further description of our benefits please go to https://worldatwork.org/careers.
